Interface AuditLogger

    • create

      void create(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, String type, Map<String,Object> object) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Creates a new object in the object set.

      On completion, this method sets the _id property to the assigned identifier for the object, and the _rev property to object version if optimistic concurrency is supported.

      Parameters:
      context - the Context for the request
      type - the requested type of audit object to create.
      object - the contents of the object to create in the object set.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or object set is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

    • read

      Map<String,Object> read(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, String type, String localId) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Reads an object from the object set.

      The returned object will contain metadata properties, including relative object identifier _id. If optimistic concurrency is supported, the object version _rev will be set in the returned object. If optimistic concurrency is not supported, then _rev must be null or absent.

      Parameters:
      context - the Context for the request
      type - the type of audit log entry to read
      localId - the id of the object to log
      Returns:
      the requested object.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

    • query

      void query(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryRequest request, org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryResourceHandler handler, String type, boolean formatted) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Performs a query on the specified object and returns the associated result. The execution of a query is not allowed to incur side effects.

      Queries are parametric; a set of named parameters is provided as the query criteria. The query result is a JSON object structure composed of basic Java types; its overall structure is defined by the implementation.

      Parameters:
      context - the Context for the request
      request - the QueryRequest object.
      handler - the QueryResourceHandler object.
      type - the type of audit log entries to query
      formatted - whether to format the results.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or the specified query is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
